This is a tiny tapas bar right near the Picasso Museum.  We were really lucky to snag a table way in the back of this place, as seating is very limited.  Service was friendly and they tried very hard to describe each item in english.  You order at the bar, and they will bring you your selections to your table.  The food was pretty good.  We had some tasty cheese, meats, and veggie dishes.  I particularly liked the roasted potatoes with garlic mayo and mini cheese stuffed red bell peppers.The food was good, but I'm not sure I can justify the prices being so high.  We were shocked at how much the bill came out to.  I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here, but it's a decent option if you're nearby exploring the gothic quarter and need a place to eat.
